description:
Ever dream of sailing off into the sunset on your own sailboat?  ‘Sailing Nervous’ is the story of two novice sailors - married for 30 years -  searching for freedom and fun by facing obstacles, overcoming fear, and learning to sail to different shores. The 'Sailing Nervous' series will trace their progress as they attempt to make their dream a reality. From dreaming of sailing, to learning how to sail, to buying a boat, to fixing the boat up for sailing, and then finally beginning their journey aboard, they invite you to come along.  

Episodes will be posted every Friday at 12:00 noon  (Eastern standard time - USA) 

Thanks for subscribing!
title: Sailing Nervous

description:
Welcome to my channel dedicated to sailing.

Back in 2006 the wife and I noticed our business was falling off. By late 2007 it was apparent that we were headed into a recession. We researched a LOT and came to the conclusion that things were starting to fail. We made a decision to buy a sailboat, learn to sail, pay off all debt and move aboard. Our idea was that from then on we should just invest what we had into tangibles for our retirement instead of giving our money to a bank/broker/investor that would end up stealing or losing it.

We're over half way to our goal. We live aboard 50% of the time. Our money does not go into an account to be lost or devalued by our government/banking system, but into our sailboat and food supplies that will last us months, if not years. We plan to sail south into the Pacific and island hop. We will farm the sea, fish, grow food here and there, barter services, and visit islands.

Come join us while we learn and ready ourselves for our voyage!
title: Tom SailBeforeSunset

description:
Adventure travel videos produced on a sailboat. Starting in Alaska and sailing around the world.

FOLLOW US AS WE SET OFF TO EXPLORE THE WORLD WITH A CAMERA IN HAND.
We plan to record our journey with the mission to educate and inspire others to think for themselves and live passionately. To be the change they want to see. To live healthy and sustainably.

VENTURE LIVES IN ALL OF US. DARE TO TAKE RISKS?
JOIN US FOR THIS EPIC ADVENTURE!
title: Venture Lives

description: around Britain in a small boat - for galleries, maps and all films go to  http://keepturningleft.co.uk/ - these films look better on your telly
title: KeepTurningLeft

description:
I am a Norwegian boat captain. Here I will post some of my adventures in Norway and Scandinavia, and maybe occasional sneak aboard someone others boat/ship.

( We have bought ourselvs a new boat. It's called the Tardis, it's a Westcruiser 32 powerboat. It' needs total renovation.)
title: Boating Scandinavia

description:
New to all this YouTube video stuff ... Not as a YouTube watcher, but making videos and having stuff online. So please bear with us ...

We are a couple who are passionate about getting our own sailboat.
On the canal, you can follow us in connection with finding the right boat, see some of them we will look at, etc.

Sebastian set foot on the first sailboat when he was about 13 years and has raced for several years, including a Elvtröm 717 - One Off, and an International 806. If, however, had a break of 10 years.

Camilla is a complete beginner, she has only sailed with ferries than to d. April 18, 2015, where she first set foot on a sailboat. She was hooked immediately, and learn very quickly what to do and when.
title: S/Y Idéfix

description: welcome to my new (english spoken) sailing channel. here you`ll find loads of video footage about my single handed atlantic crossing in 2012/2013. because all footage was shot in german it will take some time before all footage is shown in english versions. leave a comment and vote. thanks .. ahoy !
title: Guidos Sailing Channel

description:
Hi and welcome to fun N stuff with the Foxwells

We are a family of three with Ian playing the role of Dad. Hannah being Mum and Elizabeth being, well, just Izzy. Plus special guest appearances by our toy poodle Winnie (thats Winnie the Poo....dle)

We live, work and sail on the east coast of England and this channel is a collection of films showing our life as it happens.

We hope you enjoy it, and if you do tell your friends.
title: funNstuff with the Foxwells

description: With one tour in Georgia and another in North Carolina we were able to sail some beautiful and warm waters of the south. After finishing my Army obligation we moved to NYC, where we will sail the more frigid waters of the Long Island Sound for two years with our two daughters.
title: TheCapedory

description: Sailing, cruising, single-handed.
title: Christian Williams

description: Chronicling the refit and ongoing adventures of LIttle Bear, a Westsail 32 sail boat currently moored in British Columbia, Canada. Light hearted and fun we don't take ourselves at all seriously. Come and watch the (mis)adventures of Dread Pirate Biff & Crew.
title: Wake for Me

description:
Accidental Sailor Girl is a real life diary of how to live on a sailboat. Welcome aboard! 
Please subscribe to my channel "Accidental Sailor Girl" and visit my website papersailor.com to learn more about my book Accidental Sailor Girl.
title: Accidental Sailor Girl

description: Mostly outdoor-related video's.. Related to the sports I enjoy, such as rock climbing, mountainbiking, kayaking, scuba diving, sailing, hiking, xc-skating.. Jarl Adventures is a blog I've been posting on since 2006, you're welcome to visit ..
title: ExpatMoe

description: Sail with us on the best destinations around the world! Discover new cultures, stunning landscapes and delicious food.
title: Kismet Adventures

description:
All about Sailing, Simplicity & the Pursuit of Happiness w/ Teresa Carey & Ben Eriksen.  Sailing adventures aboard a Nor'sea 27, a Bristol Channel Cutter 28, and now a Norseman 447. 

Our first film One Simple Question is being released in 2015 (finally). Our new project Hello Ocean, is an ocean conservation sailing adventure that strives to drive a pro ocean message into mainstream media. 2015 promises more videos here!

In an effort to sustain our lifestyle, and help fund Hello Ocean, we started a sail training business. Our combined 45 years and 75,000 miles of sailing experience along with many years in education help us offer an intense and intimate learning environment.
title: Sailing Simplicity

description:
Cruising, racing, and living aboard a 1978 Standfast 33.
Exploring and D.I.Y. projects.
title: Sailing Lolita

description:
WWW.FOLLOWTHEBOAT.COM
[] *** Tales (not just) from the high seas *** []


Originally the video channel to accompany www.followtheboat.com, the travelogue of photographer Jamie Furlong and travel writer Liz Cleere, who are sailing around the world with their cat, Millie, in a kind of zig-zag fashion.

With a growing number of people subscribing to our youtube channel we are putting more effort into our video updates.

Help support us and make our videos even better by clicking this link: https://www.patreon.com/followtheboat
title: followtheboat

description:
Welcome to the Sailing Adventures of Pirate Booty. 

In 2013 I  found 'Pirate Booty' a 32' 1987 Sidelman  295 32' Sailboat' abandoned in Miami, FL    She was in less than Perfect Shape.  
 She has a 13 HP Internal Yanmar Diesel and 5 Sails, 8' Beam and was in need of much work.  I have taken her out on a few trial runs, she is a Dream.

 I want to share all the Restoration Work I do with you, the other Dreamers who want boats of their own!  This is my 3rd Sailboat I have restored. I want to save you $$ and get your Dreams Going by my video's and examples and show what many don't or I could never find and had to create. 

This Sailboat in the end cost me 0 Dollars.  Through it being abandoned, the owner missing, I tracked it back though owners until I found one.  She signed the boat over to me for free!

Follow and Subscribe as I redo her Electrical, Plumbing, Wood Work and Rigging. 

This will prepare me for my next  Dream ... Get her all Ship Shape and Sail to the Bahamas !
title: Kelly Williamson

description: Short videos of what and where the Nor'Sea 27, Guenevere, and her crew go to and do.
title: Greg Delezynski

description:
Join us, James & Angela, and take a glimpse into our lives aboard our Westsail 32 sailboat. 
We will feature the joys and challenges of living aboard, the ongoing projects, our plans and goals, and little adventures.

Having purchased the boat of our dreams and moved aboard in the past year, we are still new to this life and eager to share it with others!
title: Through the Portlight

description:
Sailing the World. One country at a time. One project at a time. Creating videos of our journey, adventures, life on board, and lessons learned along the way. Join us aboard our all electric, 1972 Pearson 36 as we sail the world, one step at a time.  

It all started with a friend who gave us wise advice. He said, “…don't buy a couch!" Long story short, we never did. Instead we bought a sailboat. 

Want to know more? Check out our website and join us on our adventure.
title: Sailing Uma

description: This is a place for you to share in my sailing adventures and get a little education with seminar, how-to's, and boat tours.
title: Sailor Dick

description: International Lifestyle Includes: Motorcycles, Food, and other random Amusements
title: jorgecornet

description:
My name is Alex Dorsey. I'm a film maker that got fed up with the industry and wanted to do something a little different. I bought a small sail boat and decided to document my experiences cruising. In the last 5 years I've sailed from Mystic Connecticut, 1000 miles down the ICW, through the Bahamas, Jamaica, and across the Caribbean to Cartagena Colombia. After that I produced my first film in the Project BlueSphere series "California to Colombia". 

After that I lived in the San Blas Islands of Panama with the Kuna Indians for a year before transiting the Panama Canal and single handing my 28' sailboat "Namaste" 8000 miles across the Pacific to Brisbane Australia "What a ride"! 

If you would like more information please check out www.projectbluesphere.com. From my website you can read daily logs, check out pictures and video clips, or buy my DVD's. 

Cheers guys!

Alex Dorsey
www.projectbluesphere.com
title: Alexander Dorsey

description: Share our misery and mayhem as we restore a derelict 1976 Westerly Centaur, learn to sail off England's North East coast and attempt to persuade our dogs that sailing really can be fun. We began filming as way to capture and share the progress we have made so far on our journey towards becoming competent sailors.
title: Better than it was (sailing Boukadoura)

description: Still working on pairing down the land lubber stuff, but living aboard and loving life. Meeting great new friends on this adventure, and making new memories with our young family.
title: H N Sail

description:
We are Drake and Monique sailing around the world aboard our 42 foot sailboat and home 'Paragon.' 

Here on youtube.com/ParagonSkies, we will be publishing aerial videos of the places we have sailed to.

See our story and our other 'cruising life' videos on our other channel youtube.com/DrakeParagon.

If you are enjoying our aerial videos, then consider helping us with our video production expenses by becoming a ParagonSkies Patreon supporter at http://www.patreon.com/ParagonSkies  Or you can also help us out by sending us a Paypal donation at https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_donations&business=DrakeParagon%40gmail%2ecom&lc=US&item_name=ParagonSkies%20%2d%20Aerial%20videos%20from%20all%20over%20the%20world&currency_code=USD&bn=PP%2dDonationsBF%3abtn_donateCC_LG%2egif%3aNonHosted

Thank you for flying with us! :)
title: ParagonSkies

description: Official YouTube of Helena Micy! *New single from the forthcoming album "Body and Soul" is coming out April 2014! Stay tuned!*
title: HeLLena M

description:
Our goal is to challenge ourselves and our vessel and by so doing learn and grow; to share our experiences and the lessons learned through our videos and written logs and to promote small boat cruising in general and the American Vega Association in particular.


Adventure:
1. an exciting or very unusual experience.
2. participation in exciting undertakings or enterprises: the spirit of adventure.
3. a bold, usually risky undertaking; hazardous action of uncertain outcome.

In other words, adventure is what you get when you don't get what you planned for.

Cruising in a small boat like our Albin Vega 27, Lealea, offers plenty of opportunities for adventure.  Join us and learn what we've done right and what we, perhaps, should have done differently.


Watch in chronological order by clicking the Playlists.
title: Cruising Lealea

description: Just an old goat having some fun.
title: Old Goat

description:
Step aboard Tuuli, which means "wind" in Finnish. Join us in preparing our sailboat for longterm cruising and life's little sailing adventures in between

We are an American/German couple currently in the process of getting our sailboat, ready for some long term cruising.
title: Two aboard Tuuli

description: More information about my photo gear, travel videos, travel photos and travel guide for Thailand, Cambodia and Laos on www.travel-photo-planet.com and https://www.facebook.com/TravelPhotoPlanet  . My portfolio is available for view and purchase on http://500px.com/oggiwara1 .
title: Svein Arne Grønnevik

description:
The Subway Sailor Channel is a channel created by a regular New York City working person, with a high level of ambition and curiosity towards sailing and crossing the Atlantic Ocean. 

I purchased a Southern Cross 28, a pocket cruiser that has been around the world, and decided that I would fix it up and take it somewhere far in order to have a great time and accomplish my goal of eventually crossing the Atlantic back home to Spain.  Follow me in order to get things done.
title: Subway Sailor

description:
What I like about my boat Molly (also known as "the cork") is that she really follows the waves like a seabird.
She never tries to go "through" the waves, she always floats above them!

Don't be afraid to comment and - why not subscribe to my instructive little video clips! 

Never forget that the films are made for those who appreciate a bit of humor, if you don't like what you see, I suggest you just go on. 
For what I don't want to do with my small videos, is to make you angry or disappointed.

Enjoy.
title: TheBadaren

description:
This channel is dedicated to documenting our experiences from purchasing, learning to sail Southern Cross sailing on the Pacific Ocean and eventually moving full time onto her to sail the world. We want to share our experiences with everyone who has dreamed of a life on the water. We have learned a lot of valuable information along the way with little guidance and know how intimidating of a process it can be. Our plan is to do a Pacific crossing from San Diego to the Southern Islands and after that who knows where we will end up.
 
.
  Southern Cross is a 1983 O'Day 39  built in Fall River, MA and is a USCG Documented Vessel. She turns salt water into fresh water and produces her own electricity. Join our adventure! Please subscribe and follow us on Facebook for continuing updates


Thanks again and enjoy.
S/V Southern Cross & Crew
https://twitter.com/svsoutherncross
https://www.google.com/+SVSouthernCross
https://www.facebook.com/pages/SV-Southern-Cross/600832790017022
title: S/V Southern Cross

description: Sailing simply in search of adventure.  This is the YouTube channel for Setforsea.com and will feature sailing and cruising lifestyle related videos.  This is also the home of the video series "Life with Idle Queen", showing the low-budget refit and cruising on the Dreadnought 32 cutter, "Idle Queen".  Please be sure to visit the website Setforsea.com for stories that weren't captured on video.
title: setforsea

description: Follow along as we restore an old 1968 Cheoy Lee sailboat.
title: SailBros

description:
Welcome to the Sailing Monea youtube channel!

Here you can follow our adventures aboard Monea sailing the Luleå archipelago, Bothnian bay, Sweden.

We are not circumnavigators, salty pirates or full time live-aboards. We are merely a couple who just bought a small cruiser and loves to sail. Our contribution to the worldwide sailing community will be to tell you about the wonderful Luleå archipelago situated just south of the polar circle. We would love to see more international cruisers in our waters and therefore we will post videos of us sailing under the mythical midnight sun and anchoring at some of the most popular Islands. Hopefully this will inspire you to discover the Luleå archipelago yourself.

Welcome!

/Frida & P-A
title: Sailing Monea

description:
I have a lot of dreams, especially about sailing.
So far I have been so lucky to live a few of my dreams…

On this channel, I will do my best, to give you an insight into my sailing life.

Im sailing an Albin Ballad, it is named Blue Bird.
title: Sailing Blue Bird

description: A film about living your questions  and seeking simple adventures. A quest to find an iceberg aboard a small boat. Discovery of the biggest iceberg in the last 150 years. Discovery of a fulfilling life path.
title: One Simple Question

description: This channel is dedicated to the restoration of a Chrysler C26 Sailboat named "Maverick" and the adventures in sailing her.
title: Maverick Sailing
